Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's easy to accidentally create more than 1, even with a lib. The codebase I inherited created 1 RPC connection per file that needed to touch RPC, it wasn't cached somewhere globally

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i noticed stuff was really slow, it was creating new connections and  they were fighting each other, locking each other, since they were polling

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: Q: If I launch an asset chain today without `-cc=1`, can I easily upgrade to `-cc=1` later ?

Author: bartwr#6773
Content: (I think it's mostly miners that decide if they run the flag or not, right?)

Author: xRobeSx#5136
Content: I'm pretty sure it requires a hardfork. James just added a -cc height activation yesteray though. I don't see why not just launch it with `-cc=2` from the start so you don't have to worry if you want it later

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: -ac_ccactivate is in testing now, it will allow to enable CC contracts after a certain height, but keep in mind it is a hardforking change even if it is a runtime hardfork and all nodes must update or go onto a fork

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: all nodes must have the same -ac_cc or -ac_ccactivate

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that sounds useful to ease-into CC contracts after a pre-determined time 游녨

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `-ac_cc=2 -ac_activate=HEIGHT` where HEIGHT gives you enough time to prepare for CC contracts, would be a reasonable default for new asset chains

Author: bartwr#6773
Content:
Re: jl777c & dukeleto:

Clear. So if I want smart contract capabilities for my asset chain I have to add `-cc=2`. It seems better to start immediately with smart contract capabilities enabled.

Q: Are there any disadvantages for running an asset chain with smart contract capabilities? For example security wise?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c is there any reason to not recommend that new AC's use `cc=2` by default?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: James probably has a better answer than me

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i think it's very small risk to enable CC and not need it or want it, than to not create your AC and then down the line want to enable it

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there are things that you will want to access, as an asset chain, where you will need to have `cc=1 or cc=2` to do certain things

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: for example, BTCH will store BTC headers in the future, and an asset chain with cryptoconditions will be able to utilize BTCH information, while those without it will not. If i understand correctly

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: now the initial CC contracts are tested, it seems reasonable to just enable it, -ac_cc=2 will allow cross chain things if notarized

Author: bartwr#6773
Content:
Great, thank you for your advice @dukeleto @jl777c 游땎
(I will enable smart contracts immediately when creating my asset chain, using the `-ac_cc` parameter)

Content: @Mylo you dont have to do anything special to sign it. when you call faucetget,it returns an already signed transaction, ready to be broadcast.

Content: the only thing about rawtransactions you need to do is sendrawtransaction. I have it not do it automatically, so during testing you can decoderawtransaction to make sure it looks ok
